sen.j: 太上皇（たいじょうこう）は、退位した存命の皇帝に送られる尊号のことである。
sen.e: Taijoko is the honorary title given to a retired emperor in his/her life.
The Taijoko is the honorary title given to a retired emperor or empress in his or her life.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。or empress を補いました。his or her と修正しました。
sen.e: The Taijoko is the honorary title given to a retired emperor or empress in his or her life.
'Taijo' means the 'highest.'
'Taijo' means the 'highest.'
'Taijo' means the 'highest.'

sen.j: 日本では上皇とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also referred to as joko (retired emperor) in Japan.
It is also referred to as joko (retired emperor) in Japan.
It is also referred to as joko (retired emperor) in Japan.

sen.j: 日本の上皇については太上天皇参照。
sen.e: For joko in Japan, refer to the Daijo Tenno section.
For joko in Japan, refer to the Daijo Tenno section.
For joko in Japan, refer to the Daijo Tenno section.

sen.j: 太上皇の后妃は皇太后ないし太皇太后である。
sen.e: The empress of a taijoko is calledkotaigo (empress dowager) or taikoutaigo (grand empress dowager).
The empress of a taijoko is called kotaigo (empress dowager) or taikotaigo (grand empress dowager).
sen.cmt: calledkotigo→called kotaigo,taikoutaigo→taikotaigo と修正しました。
sen.e: The empress of a taijoko is called kotaigo (empress dowager) or taikotaigo (grand empress dowager).

sen.j: 西晋の恵帝 (西晋)、唐の李淵、睿宗 (唐)、玄宗 (唐)、南宋の高宗 (宋)、明の英宗 (明)、清の乾隆帝等がいる。
sen.e: Chinese taijoko are Emperor Hui in West Jin (West Jin), Li Yuan in Tang, Yejong (Tang), Xuan Zong (Tang), Gao Zong in Southern Sung (Sung), Yingzong of Ming (Ming), Qian Long of Ching, etc.
Chinese taijoko are the Emperor Hui in West Jin (West Jin), Li Yuan in Tang, Yejong (Tang), Xuan Zong (Tang), Gao Zong in Southern Sung (Sung), Yingzong of Ming (Ming), Qian Long of Ching, etc.
Chinese taijoko are the Emperor Hui in West Jin (West Jin), Li Yuan in Tang, Yejong (Tang), Xuan Zong (Tang), Gao Zong in Southern Sung (Sung), Yingzong of Ming (Ming), Qian Long of Ching, etc.

sen.j: また、日本の後高倉法皇のように帝位には即かなかったものの、没後若しくは存命中に子が皇帝となり王朝を開いたが故に、太上皇の称号を贈られた例として、秦の始皇帝の父・荘襄王、漢の劉邦の父・劉太公がいる。
sen.e: An example of taijoko who didn't ascend to the throne himself but granted the title posthumously or in life because his child became an emperor and founded a dynasty, as in the case of Japanese Cloistered Emperor Gotakakura, is the King Zhangxiang, who was the father of the first Qin Emperor, and Liu Taigong, who was the father of Liu Bang of Han.

Also, examples of taijoko who did not ascend to the throne himself but was granted the title posthumously or in life because his child became an emperor and founded a dynasty, as in the case of the Japanese Cloistered Emperor Gotakakura, are the King Zhangxiang, who was the father of the first Qin Emperor, and Liu Taigong, who was the father of Liu Bang of Han.
sen.cmt: Also, the, was を補いました。an example→examples,didn't→did not,is→are と修正しました。
sen.e: Also, examples of taijoko who did not ascend to the throne himself but was granted the title posthumously or in life because his child became an emperor and founded a dynasty, as in the case of the Japanese Cloistered Emperor Gotakakura, are the King Zhangxiang, who was the father of the first Qin Emperor, and Liu Taigong, who was the father of Liu Bang of Han.

tit.cmt: 韓国：現在の韓国というよりも、広く朝鮮半島の歴史を扱っているようです。

sen.j: 李氏朝鮮では、1897年10月12日、高宗 (朝鮮王)が国号を大韓帝国とし朝鮮初の皇帝に即位をした。
sen.e: In Yi Dynasty Korea, Gao Zong (King of Korea) designated the name of a country to The Korean Empire, and became the first Korean Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Yi Dynasty Korea, Gao Zong (the King of Korea) designated the name of the country to the Korean Empire, and became the first Korean emperor.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。a→the,The→the,Emperor→emperor と修正しました。
sen.e: In the Yi Dynasty Korea, Gao Zong (the King of Korea) designated the name of the country to the Korean Empire, and became the first Korean emperor.

sen.j: が、近隣諸国の内政に対する介入がある中で、親露政策をとり、日本の干渉の排除を志向した。
sen.e: Amid intervention by neighboring countries, he adopted the pro-Russian policy and tried to exclude intervention by Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Amid the intervention by neighboring countries, he adopted the pro-Russian policy and tried to exclude the intervention by Japan.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。intervention→interventions と修正しました。
sen.e: Amid the intervention by neighboring countries, he adopted the pro-Russian policy and tried to exclude the intervention by Japan.

sen.j: その象徴的な出来事がハーグ密使事件であり、朝鮮に対する日本の支配を排除するため、その不合理を国際社会に訴えたが、これが頓挫した上、日本との関係をより悪化させた。
sen.e: One symbolic episode is the Hague Secret Emissary Affair, in which Korea tried to exclude Japanese rule by demonstrating its illegitimacy to the international community, but the trial failed and the Korea-Japan relationship deteriorated.

One symbolic episode is the Hague Secret Emissary Affair, in which Korea tried to exclude Japanese rule by demonstrating its illegitimacy to the international community, but the trial failed and the Korea-Japan relationship deteriorated.

One symbolic episode is the Hague Secret Emissary Affair, in which Korea tried to exclude Japanese rule by demonstrating its illegitimacy to the international community, but the trial failed and the Korea-Japan relationship deteriorated.

sen.j: そのため李完用など親日派勢力により皇帝の退位が画策され、7月20日、皇太子への譲位に追い込まれ太上皇となった。
sen.e: On this occasion, Yi Wan-yong and other Japanophile members planned to depose the Emperor, who was forced to pass the throne on to the Prince on July 20 and become a retired emperor.
On this occasion, Lee Wan-yong and other pro-Japanese people planned to depose the emperor, who was forced to pass the throne on to the crown prince on July 20 and become a retired emperor.
sen.cmt: Yi→Lee,Japanophile members→pro-Japanese people, （Japanophile: terribly obsessed with Japan との意味合いが強いので）Emperor→emperor,Prince→crown prince と修正しました。
sen.e: On this occasion, Lee Wan-yong and other pro-Japanese people planned to depose the emperor, who was forced to pass the throne on to the crown prince on July 20 and become a retired emperor.

sen.j: 太上皇、太上天皇といった東アジアの上皇としては最後の例となる。
sen.e: He was the last retired emperor among East Asian taijoko or daijo tenno (both meaning retired emperor).
He was the last retired emperor among East Asian taijoko or daijo tenno (both meaning retired emperor).
He was the last retired emperor among East Asian taijoko or daijo tenno (both meaning retired emperor).

sen.j: ベトナムにおける太上皇の称号は中国や韓国と異なり、国内に限り君主号としての意味を持っていた。
sen.e: In Vietnam, the title of taijoko was different from those in China or Korea, and meant the title of the monarch in the country.
In Vietnam, the title of taijoko was different from those in China or Korea, and meant the title of the monarch only in domestically.
sen.cmt: in the country→only in domestically と修正しました。
sen.e: In Vietnam, the title of taijoko was different from those in China or Korea, and meant the title of the monarch only in domestically.

sen.j: 歴代王朝は代々中国皇帝に朝貢をしていたが、一方で皇帝がその諱（本名）を他国に知られてその臣下扱いされることを潔しとしなかった。
sen.e: Although successive dynasties had paid tribute to the Chinese Emperors, Vietnamese emperors were unwilling to be treated as a vassal by disclosing their real names to other countries.

Although successive dynasties had paid tribute to the Chinese Emperors for generations, the Vietnamese emperors were unwilling to be treated as a vassal by disclosing their real names to other countries.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。for generations を補いました。
sen.e: Although successive dynasties had paid tribute to the Chinese Emperors for generations, the Vietnamese emperors were unwilling to be treated as a vassal by disclosing their real names to other countries.

sen.j: そこで皇帝が早い段階で後継者に帝位を譲って太上皇となり王室内の最高意思決定と対外（中国）交渉を行い、皇帝は内政一般を扱うという慣習が成立した。
sen.e: Such background brought about the custom under which an emperor would pass the throne on to the successor at an early stage and become a retired emperor to act as the top decision maker and deal with foreign policy (China), and have the new emperor dealt with domestic affairs.

Such background brought about the custom under which an emperor would pass the throne on to the successor at an early stage, and became a retired emperor to act as the top decision maker and dealt with foreign policy (China), while the new emperor dealt with domestic affairs.
sen.cmt: カンマを補いました。become→became,deal→dealt,and have→while と修正しました。
sen.e: Such background brought about the custom under which an emperor would pass the throne on to the successor at an early stage, and became a retired emperor to act as the top decision maker and dealt with foreign policy (China), while the new emperor dealt with domestic affairs.

sen.j: このため、中国への朝貢は太上皇が「国王」を名乗って行っており、中国正史とベトナムの正史が伝えるベトナム君主の在位には一代ずつのずれが生じているといわれている。
sen.e: In that context, tribute to the Chinese court was conducted by the retired emperor under the name of the 'king,' and it is said that the reigns of Vietnamese monarchs according to the Chinese historiography and Vietnamese historiography are one generation out of synchronization.

In that context, the tribute to the Chinese court was conducted by the retired emperor under the name of the 'king,' and it is said that the reigns of Vietnamese monarchs according to the Chinese historiography and Vietnamese historiography are one generation out of synchronization.

In that context, the tribute to the Chinese court was conducted by the retired emperor under the name of the 'king,' and it is said that the reigns of Vietnamese monarchs according to the Chinese historiography and Vietnamese historiography are one generation out of synchronization.
